Cincinnati.Lane Theological Seminary:
Lane Theological Seminary was a Presbyterian theological college that operated from 1829 to 1932 in the Walnut Hills area of Cincinnati, Ohio.
It was named in honor of Ebenezer and William Lane, who pledged $4,000 for the new school, which was seen as a forward outpost of the Presbyterian Church in the western territories of the United States.
Prominent New England pastor Lyman Beecher moved his family (including daughter Harriet and son Henry Ward) from Boston to Cincinnati to become the first president of the Seminary in 1832.
